cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree module¶

class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.Color¶

Bases: object

Class that defines the coloring of our red-black tree, and the corresponding underlying values.

BLACK = 1¶
RED = 0¶
class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.DBDB(f)¶

Bases: object

Database class to manage Storage and RedBlackTree operations.

_storage: Storage object to manage file writes/reads _tree: RedBlackTree object to manage a Red Black Tree

>>> import os
>>> fd = os.open("/tmp/test.dbdb", os.O_RDWR | os.O_CREAT)
>>> f  = open(fd, 'r+b')
>>> db = DBDB(f)
>>> db.set("rahul", "aged")
>>> db.set("kobe", "stillyoung")
>>> db.get("rahul")
'aged'
>>> db.commit()
>>> db.close()
close()¶

Close the storage object.

commit()¶

Confirm storage is closed and commit.

Confirm storage is open and delete node with key.

Confirm storage is open and get a value for a key.

class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.RedBlackNode(left_ref, key, value_ref, right_ref, color=0)¶

Bases: object

A RedBlackNode object contains the data of a single node in a
binary tree, and stores references to the data and its two child nodes.
blacken()¶
classmethod from_node(node, **kwargs)¶

Clones a node, but with updates as specified by addtional arguments.

node: tree node to be cloned **kwargs: tree node attributes to be updated
An updated RedBlackNode object.
is_black()¶

Check is node is colored red

is_red()¶

Check is node is colored black

store_refs(storage)¶

Method for RedBlackNode object to save its contents to disk. Recursively stores the entire tree to disk.

storage: a Storage object
(our Python representation of our data on disk)
class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.RedBlackNodeRef(referent=None, address=0)¶

Bases: cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.ValueRef

A RedBlackNodeRef object is a reference to a red-black
binary tree node on disk.

Inherits from ValueRef.

static bytes_to_referent(string)¶
Deserializes the tree node (i.e., unpickles the tree node)
typically after disk retrieval.
string: value to be reconstituted
A reconstituted RedBlackNode object.
prepare_to_store(storage)¶

Have a node store its refs.

static referent_to_bytes(referent)¶
Serializes the tree node (i.e., pickles the tree node)
in preparation for disk storage.
referent: node to be encoded
A serialized tree node (e.g., a serialized BinaryNode object).
class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.RedBlackTree(storage)¶

Bases: object

Red Black Binary Tree class. Inherits from BinaryTree class, so is immutable as well

(i.e., constructs new tree on changes).
balance(node)¶

Add a new node to the tree, then balance.

node: RedBlackNode object

The node that was passed to the function.

commit()¶
get(key)¶

Retrieves the value associated with the specified key.

key: indexes the value that we want to retrieve

The value associated with key.

get_nodes_less_than(key)¶

Find all nodes that have a key value <= ‘key’

recolor(node)¶

Sets node color to red and the color of its children to black.

node: RedBlackNode object

The new recolored node.

rotate_left(node)¶
Rotates the specified node “to the left”, in order to ensure compliance
with red-black tree invariants (see module README), in particular “No red node has a red parent.” This method is used when node has a red parent.
A “left rotation” is when we switch the positions of node and
its right child (call it RC) – so node becomes the left child of RC.
node: RedBlackNode object (or None if our key/value has
not been packaged as such)

A RedBlackNodeRef object that points to the new node.

rotate_right(node)¶
Rotates the specified node “to the right”, in order to ensure compliance
with red-black tree invariants (see module README), in particular “No red node has a red parent.” This method is used when node has a red parent.
A “right rotation” is when we switch the positions of node and
its left child (call it LC) – so node becomes the right child of LC.

node: RedBlackNode object

A RedBlackNodeRef object that points to the new node.

set(key, value)¶

Sets a new value in the tree, causing a new tree to be created (b/c of immutability).

key: indexes the value that we want to store value: the data we want to store, under key

update(node, key, value_ref)¶

Recursively update and balance along the way

class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.Storage(f)¶

Bases: object

Storage class to interact with the file on disk. Manages writing to file, locking/unlocking for editing, and closing the file.”

INTEGER_FORMAT = '!Q'¶
INTEGER_LENGTH = 8¶
SUPERBLOCK_SIZE = 4096¶
close()¶

Unlock and close the file.

closed¶

Returns true if database is closed.

commit_root_address(root_address)¶

Atomically commit changes by writing the new root address to beginning of the next superblock and unlocking the file.

get_root_address()¶

Get the root address, as measured from the beginning of the file.

lock()¶

If not locked, lock the file for writing and return True.

read(address)¶

Read data from given address in file.

unlock()¶

If locked, flush and unlock the file

write(data)¶

Write data to disk, returning the address at which you wrote it.

class cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.ValueRef(referent=None, address=0)¶

Bases: object

A ValueRef object is a reference to a string value on disk.

address¶
static bytes_to_referent(bytes)¶
Converts bytes to a string, typically after reading bytes
from disk.
referent: value (a string) to be encoded
A bytes representation of the Unicode string,
encoded in UTF-8.
get(storage)¶
Reads whatever bytes are at the _address attribute,
converts to a string, saves this string as _referent, and and returns it.
storage: a Storage object
(our Python representation of our data on disk)
The string located at the _address attribute in storage.
prepare_to_store(storage)¶
static referent_to_bytes(referent)¶

Converts referent to bytes, in preparation for disk storage.

referent: value (a string) to be encoded
A bytes representation of the Unicode string,
encoded in UTF-8.
store(storage)¶
Converts whatever value is contained in the _referent
attribute to bytes, saves it to disk within storage, and records the storage address.`, and and returns it.
storage: a Storage object
(our Python representation of our data on disk)
None.

This method is called by BinaryNode.store_refs()

cs207rbtree.RedBlackTree.connect(dbname)¶

cs207rbtree.skeleton module¶

This is a skeleton file that can serve as a starting point for a Python console script. To run this script uncomment the following line in the entry_points section in setup.cfg:

console_scripts =
cs207rbtree = cs207rbtree.skeleton:run

Then run python setup.py install which will install the command cs207rbtree inside your current environment. Besides console scripts, the header (i.e. until _logger...) of this file can also be used as template for Python modules.

Note: This skeleton file can be safely removed if not needed!
